Payment partners receive emails for every order placed in their country & can choose to accept the order by copying the order ID from the email and pasting it in the payment partnership screen\r\nTo turn on/off this feature, go to settings and into the \"Payment Partnership\" screen\r\n\r\n> Simple Ledger Token (SLP) Support\r\nZapit also supports SLP tokens. It takes seconds to set up an anonymous wallet and account. \r\n\r\nCoinpay is trusted in over 100 countries worldwide, and the Coinpay team believes that Bitcoin will change the world as a currency. We encourage our users to use Bitcoin as an investment and a currency to use in the trade of goods and services. Coinpay allows users to get started with cryptocurrency in seconds rather than days or hours - unlike Coinbase and Binance. We require no personal information when signing up, so users can remain anonymous. We are a non-custodial wallet, so users can send Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies globally with direct access to the blockchain. \r\n\r\nWith Coinpay you can easily purchase (with debit card, credit card, and Apple Pay), send, and receive Bitcoin, Litecoin, and Ethereum. We provide usernames associated with your accounts public keys to make sending bitcoin and crypto to friends and family fast, easy, and secure. \r\n\r\nThe cryptocurrency in your wallets is always yours because your private key is only stored on your phone's hardware. Coinpay stores your funds in a decentralized manner because we do not have access to any of our users funds, and you always have access to your cryptocurrencies private keys. \r\n\r\nWallet Storage\r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ Create a new Bitcoin wallet or import your existing one using your private key\r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ View your public and private keys, even when you're offline\r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ Use your public key to import funds from exchanges, or have external users send or pay you cryptocurrency or Bitcoin \r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ Easily sign and send transactions on the blockchain \r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ View your previous transactions in one place\r\n\r\n‚Ä¢ Backup your wallets by exporting your private keys. You can also compare the performance of Bitcoin in different currencies (Euro, Dollar, Sterling) and even measure Bitcoin against Altcoins like Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, Litecoin, Ripple, IOTA, XLM, EOS & DASH.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Change & Volatility Monitor:\r\nThe Change & Volatility Monitor describes the direction and magnitude of price fluctuations. If Bitcoin performed positively within the given time span, it is colored in green. Otherwise it is colored in red. Further intervals allow you to examine the price action more closely. The displayed price for an interval is the average price of all exchanges for that moment. Its relative change compared to the price 24 hours ago gives you an understanding of the trend and volatility of the market.\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Cross Coin Check\r\nOur Cross Coin Check gives you a broad insight into market developments and allows you to compare Bitcoin (BTC), Ethereum (ETH), Ripple (XRP), Bitcoin Cash (BCH), Litecoin (LTC) and IOTA (MIOTA) among each other. For this purpose, we continuously calculate all the prices and calculate the relation to each other. It is important for us to emphasize that the prices are obtained directly and unaltered by the exchanges! That means, our exchange rates are not manipulated (yes, we're hinting at 'Coinmarketcap').\r\n\r\n‚òÜ Trade Signals\r\nOur purely AI driven trade signals provide you with up-to-date trade recommendations. You can use these recommendations (strong sell, sell, neutral, buy, strong buy) to support your buy, sell or HODL decisions.\r\n\r\nThe current prices for Bitcoin, Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, Ripple, Litecoin, XLM, EOS, DASH and IOTA are obtained directly from the exchanges and are not altered like on Coinmarketcap. These mobile health apps have helped in the documenting the lives of the users. Further work, however, is needed to integrate the use of mobile health apps into the clinical care delivery system and to prove the effectiveness of these apps. The GIM App is one of such applications. It is currently being used in the Center for Motility and Functional GI Disorders at Boston Children‚Äôs Hospital as part of clinical care to track patient symptoms, progress, and outcomes. The main idea behind the GIM App is that it will assist physicians in providing the best possible evidence-based care to their patients.
